sect1.title: SPOT WELD TEST CYCLE
sect1.para: This page describes the settings for the test cycle to confirm the correct operation of the robot or gun before automatic operation is executed in the conditions of production. This page describes the spot weld test cycle screen and its items.
You must set the following items to appropriate values.

entry.para: Gun operation
Cannot be changed if a program is running

This item allows you to select the type of gun mode that will be used when running the program.
STROKE - opens and closes the gun at each weld point. Passing current depends on the setting of weld controller mode.
NOSTROKE - does not close and open the gun, and does NOT pass current through the gun. Backup stroke will still function. The weld controller mode must be set to NOWELD.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed on this screen. Use Stroke/NO STROKE cell input signal to control this.
Program select mode is RSR/PNS/OTHER
Teach pendant is DISABLE
Program select mode is STYLE
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO
Weld controller mode
Cannot be changed if a program is running

This item allows you to select the type of weld mode that will be used when running the program
WELD - when the gun closes, the weld controller executes the appropriate schedule and passes current through the gun.
NOWELD - no current passes through the gun when the weld controller executes the weld sequence. NOTE: If you do not use “Enable weld” signal in weld interface I/O, you have to set the weld controller into NOWELD by your plc.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed on this screen. Use Weld/NO WELD cell input signal to control this.
Program select mode is RSR/PNS/OTHER
Teach pendant is DISABLE
Program select mode is STYLE
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO

note.para: In case of integrated weld controller, the weld controller is started with no current. In case of digital interface weld controller, PLC should command NOWELD to the weld controller. So WELD/NO WELD input signal of Cell Interface I/O should be set to OFF.

entry.para: Refer to section 8.2 for the way not to output weld schedule.

This item enables and disables the ability of the robot to tryout mode.
ENABLED - In case of servo gun, thickness on SPOT instruction need not be changed, and pressure shortage error is not generated even if there is no panel.
DISABLED - In case of servo gun, pressure motion is normally executed with thickness for pressure on SPOT instruction.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed on this screen. Use Tryout Mode cell input signal to control this.
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO

note.para: You have to assign the tryout input in cell interface to use this mode.

entry.para: If the tryout input is not defined, you can not change the status of this item. The Tryout cell output signal reports the status of tryout mode.

note.para: Even if tryout mode is enabled, open distance and trajectory of tips and timing of deceleration is same as case that there is panel (tryout mode is disabled). Even if there is no panel, gun motion is decelerated before panel position. So cycle time of tryout mode is difference from cycle time of case that there is panel (tryout mode is disabled).
Even If welding is enabled during tryout mode , welding is executed.

entry.para: This field allows the programmed weld schedule to be automatically overridden when tryout mode is active. The weld schedule output is changed to the value set in this field.
Tipdress instructions are not affected.
Set to 0 to disable this feature.
This item enables the weld simulation. Refer to the next section for more details.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed.
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO

This item allows you to force the process complete signal.
ENABLED - Process Complete is turned on immediately. Process Complete will be cleared at the start of the next style. The Process Alert signal is turned on whenever Force Process Complete is enabled, and a warning error is displayed on the ALARMS screen to indicate that this abnormal operation was performed.
DISABLED - Process Complete is turned off.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed.
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO

If the weld controller controls weld pressure (the Controls weld pressure item is enabled at spot config), Update weld pressures is displayed.
ENABLED - This will force an update of the weld pressure table from the weld controller.
DISABLED - Update Weld Pressures is turned off

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed.
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO
Tip dress when TP is On:
Dresser Rotation

This item allows you to enable or disable rotation of the tip dresser cutter in tip dress instruction.
ENABLED - This state enables the cutter to rotate in tip dress instruction.
DISABLED - This state disables the cutter to rotate in tip dress instruction.

When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed and rotation of the cutter is enabled.
Teach pendant is DISABLE
3 mode switch is AUTO
This item is displayed only when servo tip dresser option is installed.
Tip dress when TP is On:
Pressure on Dress

This item allows you to enable or disable gun closing in tip dress instruction.
ENABLED - This state enables the gun to close in tip dress instruction.
DISABLED - This state disables the gun to close in tip dress instruction.
When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed and gun closing is enabled.
This item is displayed only when servo tip dresser option is installed.

This item allows you to lock or unlock the tip dresser.
ENABLED - Tip dresser is unlocked so is available and error will be posted if the controller cannot communicate with the tip dresser.
DISABLED - Tip dresser is locked so is not available, but TP program with tip dress instruction can be executed even if tip dresser is not connected.
When following conditions consist, this item cannot be changed.
This item is displayed only when servo tip dresser option is installed.

step.para: Press the [MENU] key, then select TEST CYCLE.
Press F1, [TYPE], then select Spot Weld.

sect1.title: WELD SIMULATION
sect1.para: Weld Simulate allows you to test the cycle time of a job without having to set up any external hardware I/O signals.

When you use weld simulate to test the cycle time of a job, the robot will close the gun, and wait for a period of time that is equal to the weld duration you specify on the spot weld test cycle screen. After the robot has simulated the weld, it will move to the next point in the welding sequence, and simulate another weld, until the weld sequence has been completed.
The following table shows the Weld Simulate setup items.

entry.para: Weld IO Sim
Default : DISABLE
This item enables or disables weld simulation.
When sim is disabled, robot sends schedule GOUT to weld controller, waits for weld complete DIN and checks fault input.
When sim is enabled, robot only waits for the weld sim duration time then completes. I/O operations between robot and weld controller are bypassed when weld sim is active
Weld Duration
Default: 500 Min.: 0 Max.: 32767
The duration of the dwell (wait) during the weld when weld simulation is active.

note.para: Sometimes sim weld time is not specified value.

row.entry: This output will turn on when weld simulation is active and turn off when weld simulation is inactive

sect1.para:
In order for a weld to be simulated, the following conditions must be true:
You have to set Weld controller mode to DISABLE.
You have to set Weld IO sim to ENABLE.
You have to enter a value for the WeldDuration.

listitem.para: When you run a job that uses the weld simulate feature in the place of a weld controller, the weld schedule and other I/O associated with the weld schedule will not be sent to the weld controller.
When Weld controller mode is enable, Weld IO sim becomes disable forcibly. You can not enable Weld IO sim when Weld controller mode is enable.
When power cycle, Weld IO sim becomes disable forcibly.

sect1.para: A report that shows the cycle time of the simulated weld sequence will be displayed on both the User screen and the Status screen.

When you run a job that uses weld simulation in place of a weld controller, you need to run the job from either the Use Operator Panel (UOP) or the Standard Operator Panel (SOP) for the cycle time report to be displayed on the User and Status screens.
When using weld simulate, the cycle time will not be displayed on the User and Status screens, when the job is run using the shift and forward keys on the teach pendant.
When using weld simulate, the robot must be in NOWELD.
